Senior Manager, Worldwide Partner Marketing Operations CISCO SYSTEMS, INC October 2009  –  December 2011  (2 years 3 months) Managed over 35 million budget for WW Partner Marketing Organization. 
Created streamline processes for tracking marketing activities 
Managed WW Parnter Website 
Managed all Annual planning and budgeting for WW Parnter Marketing Organization 
Streamlined Partner Communications with Governence process and email communciations tool  
Managed Virtual partner event for over 19,000 registered partners Senior Manager, Worldwide Integrated Marketing Communications Cisco Systems August 2007  –  October 2009  (2 years 3 months) Directs a team of Marketing Communication Managers with responsibility to create and execute communications plans for architecture launches, channel partner program, partner enablement, and partner marketing programs and tools.  
Create processes for team to follow on executing on monthly reports and biweekly communications to theatre marketing and marcom leads. 
Collaborate and build partnerships with the World Wide Channel Marketing organization, Solutions Marketing and the theatre counterparts to promote the Corporate Marketing relationship. 
Negotiate and develop processes to help streamline communications for worldwide channel partner communications.  
Directs complex strategic plans for execution and deployment in the theaters. 
Responsible for interfacing with senior executives on strategy and positioning of major programs and launches. 
Mentor employees on career development and areas of growth opportunity that match expertise and skill set. Integrated Marketing Communication Manager Cisco Systems October 2004  –  August 2007  (2 years 11 months) Managed and implement the global communications plan to sell and market Cisco technologies, solutions & programs to, through, and with channel partners. 
Created communications activity plans based on partner behavior, leveraging knowledge of partner attitudes and selling behaviors, to maximize the value to the partner to enhance their business. 
Led worldwide cross functional teams to develop Channel Communications Marketing plans for over 15 major product and program launches including messaging, positioning and successful execution of all deliverables.  
Drove worldwide program and launch adoption by Channel Account Managers and partners to increase Cisco and partner sales growth, partner enablement, and loyalty. 
Managed key technology events including WW Unified Communications Partner Summit, WW Security Partner Summit. Interface with senior executives on strategy, messaging, positioning, key deliverables and collaboration with other organizations.  
Mentored new team members on global communications process ensuring consistency in partner communications.  
Collaborated and built partnerships with the Worldwide Channel organization, Solutions Marketing and the theatre counterparts to promote the Corporate Marketing relationship. Integrated Marketing Communications Manager Cisco Systems January 2003  –  October 2004  (1 year 10 months) Led campaign working with Switching Technology Marketing, Business Units, Commercial and Enterprise Marketing to create a campaign increasing awareness of the Switching and Routing Portfolios. 
Successfully launched the Integrated Services Routers portfolio, a $1.5 Billion Product Line. Managed print/online advertising strategy and placement, internal, channel and customer launch event, collateral, multi-media presentations, PR/AR coordination, Cisco.com, product naming, primary market research, etc. First ever integrated campaign execution worldwide for customers and partners. 
Lead marketing communication manager for all routing product launches. Managed $2 million budget for Routing and Switching Campaigns. 
Created/Implemented outbound communications strategy for Enterprise/Commercial Infrastructure to increase market penetration with new products & solutions. 
Worked across Technology Groups for Security, Storage, Mobility, and IP Communications to ensure products and messaging are incorporated in a solution message. Marcom Manager Cisco Systems January 2001  –  January 2003  (2 years 1 month) Acted as a link between Business Unit and Corporate Communications. 
Lead marketing manager for all switching launches- Strategically recommended appropriate marketing communication plans. 
Manage all Marcom communications deliverables from concept to completion (advertising, direct marketing, print collateral, CDs, web, seminars, tradeshows and events) for High Speed Switching Business Unit.  
Initiated ways to measure Return on Investment on all Marcom activities to ensure marketing dollars were well spent. Director Marketing Communications Information Flow, Inc 1998  –  2001  (3 years) •Worked with founder to develop business plan and rewrite core LAN based sales automation software for the Application Service Provider market. 
•Developed and implemented sales and marketing plans. 
•Created new company logo, collateral materials, advertising, customer presentations and press releases.  
•Executed all aspects of tradeshow organization and management, including advertising, promotions, budgeting and return on investment evaluations.  
•Researched target market, competition, pricing and market strategies. Marketing Manager GE CAPITAL IT SOLUTIONS June 1995  –  September 1997  (2 years 4 months) At GE Capital ITS (Formerly AmeriData) Responsible for supporting nine locations, $1.3 million marketing budget, over fifty vendor and manufacturer relationships and fifty-five account managers and their customers.  
Led the marketing effort that increased one contract's business by over 200%.  
Coordinated funding and activities with Corporate Marcom.  
Supervised staff of three for all coordination of trade shows, seminars, customer and corporate events.  
Established budgets, marketing plans, and measured ROI in all 9 Regions.  
Developed customized product marketing catalogs, collateral, press releases, and direct mail adhering to all corporate and manufacturer identity guidelines. 
Maintained customer database. Instinctive ability to synthesize complex information to develop compelling campaigns, messages and storylines to inspire, influence, and educate target audiences; with the ultimate goal of improving market and mindshare for relevant products and business solutions.

Summary Lynda D'Angelo is marketing communications manager within Cisco's Corporate Marketing Organization (CMO). Primary responsibilities include marketing campaigns in support of Cisco's core Data Center initiatives. 
 
Prior to CMO, D’Angelo lead outbound marketing programs for the Cisco Internet Business Solutions Group (IBSG). As manager within IBSG’s Strategic Communications Consulting, D’Angelo developed external campaigns to raise the visibility of IBSG’s Industry Thought Leadership to the external business community as well as Cisco’s internal sales organization. Focused on video and the rise of social media, D’Angelo embraced current trends to provide relevant and timely dissemination of industry expertise across ten sectors such as healthcare, financial services, retail, and service provider.  
 
With expertise in program and event management, D’Angelo led several successful marketing campaigns for industry executives and internal stakeholders. D’Angelo spearheaded IBSG’s global customer success story initiative, highlighting impactful customer engagements with Fortune 500 companies. She managed IBSG’s presence at key industry tradeshows, including BAI, HIMSS, and Retail Systems. D’Angelo ran IBSG’s Executive Education Seminar Series and launched the global iQ Partner Program, educating partners on Internet Business Solutions. As marketing communications manager, she developed integrated marketing strategies for Cisco’s Trusted Advisor Program. 
 
Prior to IBSG, D’Angelo who joined Cisco in 1994, served as a member of Cisco’s corporate public relations team, program manager for the enterprise line of business, and marketing communications manager in industry marketing.  
 
D'Angelo graduated from the University of California, Santa Barbara with a bachelor’s degree in Communications. She received a Certificate in Marketing and Communications from San Jose State University with achievement in Internet Marketing and Advertising.
